chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T2: poset
T1: poset
S2: poset
S1: poset
f1: S1 -> T1
f2: S2 -> T2
M1: monotone f1
M2: monotone f2
s: chain [posetofS1 * S2]

Goal:
proj1_chain prod_chain = [f1^^proj1_chain sbyM1]

Premises:
proj1_chain : forall T1 T2 : poset, chain [posetofT1 * T2] -> chain T1
Record chain (T : poset) : Type := Chain { pred_of : Pred T; _ : chain_axiom pred_of } Arguments Chain [T pred_of]
monotone : forall T1 T2 : poset, (T1 -> T2) -> Prop
prod_chain = [f1 \* f2^^sbyprod_mono M1 M2] : chain (pairPoset T1 T2)
dapp_mono : forall x : ?A, monotone (@^~ x) where ?A : [S1 : poset S2 : poset T1 : poset T2 : poset f1 : S1 -> T1 f2 : S2 -> T2 M1 : monotone f1 M2 : monotone f2 s : chain [posetofS1 * S2] |- Type] ?T : [S1 : poset S2 : poset T1 : poset T2 : poset f1 : S1 -> T1 f2 : S2 -> T2 M1 : monotone f1 M2 : monotone f2 s : chain [posetofS1 * S2] |- ?A -> poset]
app_mono : forall x : ?A, monotone (@^~ x) where ?A : [S1 : poset S2 : poset T1 : poset T2 : poset f1 : S1 -> T1 f2 : S2 -> T2 M1 : monotone f1 M2 : monotone f2 s : chain [posetofS1 * S2] |- Type] ?T : [S1 : poset S2 : poset T1 : poset T2 : poset f1 : S1 -> T1 f2 : S2 -> T2 M1 : monotone f1 M2 : monotone f2 s : chain [posetofS1 * S2] |- poset]
Tagged : forall T_ : ?I -> Type, T_ ?i -> {x0 : ?I & T_ x0} where ?I : [S1 : poset S2 : poset T1 : poset T2 : poset f1 : S1 -> T1 f2 : S2 -> T2 M1 : monotone f1 M2 : monotone f2 s : chain [posetofS1 * S2] |- Type] ?i : [S1 : poset S2 : poset T1 : poset T2 : poset f1 : S1 -> T1 f2 : S2 -> T2 M1 : monotone f1 M2 : monotone f2 s : chain [posetofS1 * S2] |- ?I]
tagged : forall w : {x : ?I & ?T_ x}, ?T_ (tag w) where ?I : [S1 : poset S2 : poset T1 : poset T2 : poset f1 : S1 -> T1 f2 : S2 -> T2 M1 : monotone f1 M2 : monotone f2 s : chain [posetofS1 * S2] |- Type] ?T_ : [S1 : poset S2 : poset T1 : poset T2 : poset f1 : S1 -> T1 f2 : S2 -> T2 M1 : monotone f1 M2 : monotone f2 s : chain [posetofS1 * S2] |- ?I -> Type]
onPhantom : forall (P : ?T -> Prop) (x : ?T), phantom Prop (P x) where ?T : [S1 : poset S2 : poset T1 : poset T2 : poset f1 : S1 -> T1 f2 : S2 -> T2 M1 : monotone f1 M2 : monotone f2 s : chain [posetofS1 * S2] |- Type]
prod_mono = fun (S1 S2 T1 T2 : poset) (f1 : S1 -> T1) (f2 : S2 -> T2) (M1 : monotone f1) (M2 : monotone f2) (__top_assumption_ : pairPoset S1 S2) => (fun _evar_0_ : forall (a : S1) (b : S2), (fun p : S1 * S2 => forall y : pairPoset S1 S2, p <== y -> (f1 \* f2) p <== (f1 \* f2) y) (a, b) => let (x, x0) as p return ((fun p0 : S1 * S2 => forall y : pairPoset S1 S2, p0 <== y -> (f1 \* f2) p0 <== (f1 \* f2) y) p) := __top_assumption_ in _evar_0_...
comp_mono = fun (T1 T2 T3 : poset) (f1 : T2 -> T1) (f2 : T3 -> T2) (M1 : monotone f1) (M2 : monotone f2) (x y : T3) (H : x <== y) => M1 (f2 x) (f2 y) (M2 x y H) : forall (T1 T2 T3 : poset) (f1 : T2 -> T1) (f2 : T3 -> T2), monotone f1 -> monotone f2 -> monotone (f1 \o f2) Arguments comp_mono {T1 T2 T3} {f1 f2}%function_scope
image_chain : forall T1 T2 : poset, chain T1 -> forall f : T1 -> T2, monotone f -> chain T2
comp_chainE : forall (T1 T2 T3 : poset) (f1 : T2 -> T1) (f2 : T3 -> T2) (s : chain T3) (M1 : monotone f1) (M2 : monotone f2), [f1^^[f2^^sbyM2]byM1] = [f1 \o f2^^sbycomp_mono M1 M2]
image_chainP : forall (T1 T2 : poset) (s : chain T1) (f : T1 -> T2), monotone f -> chain_axiom [Pred x2 | exists x1 : T1, x2 = f x1 /\ x1 \In s]
proj1_diagE : forall (T : poset) (s : chain T), proj1_chain (diag_chain s) = s
tarski_lfp_fixed : forall (T : lattice) (f : T -> T), monotone f -> f (tarski_lfp f) = tarski_lfp f
tarski_gfp_fixed : forall (T : lattice) (f : T -> T), monotone f -> f (tarski_gfp f) = tarski_gfp f
id_chainE : forall (T : poset) (s : chain T) (M : monotone id), [id^^sbyM] = s
fext : forall (A : Type) (B : A -> Type) (f1 f2 : forall x : A, B x), (forall x : A, f1 x = f2 x) -> f1 = f2
proj2_chain : forall T1 T2 : poset, chain [posetofT1 * T2] -> chain T2
app_chain : forall (A : Type) (T : poset), chain [posetofA -> T] -> A -> chain T
dapp_chain : forall (A : Type) (T : A -> poset), chain (dfunPoset T) -> forall x : A, chain (T x)
Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> seq (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> seq (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C)
diag_chain : forall T : poset, chain T -> chain (pairPoset T T)
fprod : forall A1 A2 B1 B2 : Type, (A1 -> B1) -> (A2 -> B2) -> A1 * A2 -> B1 * B2
id_mono = fun (T : poset) (x y : T) => id : forall T : poset, monotone id Arguments id_mono {T}
Tauto.ror_clause_cnf : forall Term' Annot : Type, (Term' -> bool) -> (Term' -> Term' -> option Term') -> seq (Term' * Annot) -> seq (Tauto.clause Term' Annot) -> seq (Tauto.clause Term' Annot) * seq Annot
Tauto.xror_clause_cnf : forall Term' Annot : Type, (Term' -> bool) -> (Term' -> Term' -> option Term') -> seq (Term' * Annot) -> seq (Tauto.clause Term' Annot) -> seq (Tauto.clause Term' Annot) * seq Annot
const_chain : forall T2 : poset, T2 -> chain T2
BinPos.Pos.SqrtSpec_ind : forall P : BinNums.positive * BinPos.Pos.mask -> BinNums.positive -> Prop, (forall s x : BinNums.positive, x = BinPos.Pos.mul s s -> P (s, BinPos.Pos.IsNul) x) -> (forall s r x : BinNums.positive, x = BinPos.Pos.add (BinPos.Pos.mul s s) r -> BinPos.Pos.le r (BinNums.xO s) -> P (s, BinPos.Pos.IsPos r) x) -> forall (p : BinNums.positive * BinPos.Pos.mask) (p0 : BinNums.positive), BinPos.Pos.SqrtSpec p p0 -> P p p0
Tauto.eval_f = fun (TA TX AA AF : Type) (ex : TX -> Prop) (ea : TA -> Prop) => fix eval_f (f : Tauto.GFormula) : Prop := match f with | Tauto.TT => True | Tauto.FF => False | Tauto.X p => ex p | Tauto.A a _ => ea a | Tauto.Cj e1 e2 => eval_f e1 /\ eval_f e2 | Tauto.D e1 e2 => eval_f e1 \/ eval_f e2 | Tauto.N e => ~ eval_f e | Tauto.I f1 _ f2 => eval_f f1 -> eval_f f2 end : forall TA TX AA AF : Type, (TX -> Prop) -> (TA -> Prop) -> Tauto.GFormula -> Prop Arguments Tauto.eval_f {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope
prod_curry = fun (A B C : Type) (f : A -> B -> C) (p : A * B) => let (x, y) := p in f x y : forall A B C : Type, (A -> B -> C) -> A * B -> C Arguments prod_curry {A B C}%type_scope _%function_scope
pred_of : forall T : poset, chain T -> Pred T
pair_leq : forall A B : poset, A * B -> A * B -> Prop
